MEMORANDUM
February lb, 1957
TO: NAEB Officers and Directors
Members Permanent Financing Committee
(Jim Miles, Bill Harley, Dick Hull)
Executive Director
Associate Executive Director
FROM: Burton Paulu
SUBJECT: Plans for long-range permanent financing of NAEB
One of NAEB * s most important and crucial problems is permanent
financing. We are now operating on our second Kellogg grant. It expires
on June 30, 1959. After that date, how will we support those NAEB
functions now underwritten by it?
To look for answers Frank Schooley, when president, appointed a
Permanent Financing Committee consisting of Jim Miles (chairman), Bill
Harley and Dick Hull. I have reappointed this committee with the same
membership plus Ned Rosenheim.
Attached are the groupÂ®s first two reports. Chairman Miles asks that
these be distributed to you "with a note asking strongly for reaction to
the proposals and advice to the committee. We honestly do not feel we
can go much further with our deliberations until we receive such indications
of support."
Since the continuance of NAEB at its present or higher levels of
performance is entirely contingent upon finding continued financial support,
please send Jim Miles your reactions and suggestions!
